channel.title: Newegg selling pirated software
channel.description:
I bought this OBD2 scanner for $9.60:
http://www.neweggflash.com/product/9SIA2C50U52195
and spend an hour or so downloading various programs to see if it works, most of them are so severly limited I could just barely tell it worked. I figured I'd look on the small CD that came with it to see what was on there, and find multiple expensive (ie $200+) programs, complete with keygens so you could use the full versions without paying. I find this hilarious, and I assume this device came straight from china without newegg knowing what it contained, but they should have at least checked it out before selling it.
I sent neweggflash an email letting them know, but they have yet to respond. I'll update this thread when they do. :)

item.title: Newegg selling pirated software
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Free $200 software, sounds good to me.

Read full topic

Also I’m sure you could find all these keygens on the internet.

item.title: Newegg selling pirated software
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Newty:

So are you happy you bought it or are you not gonna use the pirated software? lol

Actually now that I know it works, there are a handful of free open source programs I can use under Linux, so I plan to use it that way. The hardware works well though, so I’m happy with the purchase.

Read full topic
